intro: Arabis reverchonii, commonly known as the Reverchon's rockcress, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of fleshy, silver-green leaves and produces small, white or pink flowers in the spring. The plant thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid climates. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats at high elevations. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
